name: Norwegian Digital Sovereignty Index
description: Assessment framework for digital sovereignty risk, based on EU Cloud Sovereignty Framework with Norwegian extensions

guidance.0: No identified risk or concern. Full sovereignty maintained.
guidance.1: Minimal risk, easily mitigated. Minor dependencies that don't affect sovereignty.
guidance.2: Low risk, standard mitigations available. Some foreign dependencies but manageable.
guidance.3: Moderate risk, requires attention. Notable sovereignty concerns that need addressing.
guidance.4: Significant risk, requires action plan. Serious sovereignty gaps affecting data/operations.
guidance.5: Critical risk, may be unacceptable. Fundamental sovereignty issues, consider alternatives.

low.label: Low Risk
low.description: Minimal sovereignty concerns. Provider aligns well with Norwegian/EU interests.
low.recommendation: Suitable for Norwegian organizations including public sector and sensitive data.

moderate.label: Moderate Risk
moderate.description: Some sovereignty concerns that can be addressed with available mitigations.
moderate.recommendation: Acceptable for general use. Review mitigations before handling sensitive or classified data.

elevated.label: Elevated Risk
elevated.description: Notable sovereignty gaps requiring active management and monitoring.
elevated.recommendation: Use with caution. Implement mitigations, have exit strategy, consider Norwegian alternatives.

significant.label: Significant Risk
significant.description: Serious sovereignty concerns. Subject to foreign laws that may conflict with Norwegian interests.
significant.recommendation: Avoid for sensitive data and critical infrastructure. Requires formal risk acceptance.

high.label: High Risk
high.description: Critical sovereignty issues. High exposure to foreign jurisdiction with limited control.
high.recommendation: Not recommended for Norwegian organizations. Seek Norwegian or EU alternatives.

dimensions.name: Strategic Autonomy
dimensions.description: Degree of strategic dependency on the vendor and its home jurisdiction

dimensions.name: Legal Jurisdiction
dimensions.description: Legal exposure to foreign laws (CLOUD Act, FISA, etc.)

dimensions.name: Data Sovereignty
dimensions.description: Control over data location, encryption, and access

dimensions.name: Operational Sovereignty
dimensions.description: Ability to operate independently of vendor

dimensions.name: Supply Chain
dimensions.description: Dependencies in the vendor's supply chain

dimensions.name: National Security
dimensions.description: Implications for Norwegian critical infrastructure and national security

dimensions.name: Local Presence
dimensions.description: Norwegian support, partners, and local expertise availability

cloud_act.description: True if vendor country is subject to US CLOUD Act

schrems_ii.description: True if data transfers raise Schrems II concerns

level.description: Calculated from weighted average of dimension scores
